page.title: 17Cornish Language ,Liskeard
page.content: "Dynergh dyworth fleghes Lyskerrys" - Greetings from the children of Liskeard.Some people think that Cornish is a dead language,but it isn't.In Liskeard only a few people speak Cornish fluently,but in the whole of Cornwall about 500 people speak it well and 2000 to 3000 speak some Cornish. By 1800 the Cornish language had almost disappeared,being replaced by English. Celtic languages were being spoken all over Britain when the Romans came. Cornish is similar to Welsh and Breton which are also Celtic languages.In our school a few children learn Cornish but only one boy speaks it fluently as he was brought up speaking both Cornish and English. Translations:ky-dog;cath-cat;maw-boy; mam -mother;tas-father;mowes-girl;den- man;benen-woman.
